definition: to do/to manage/to handle/to go about/to run/to set up/to deal with

sentences.english: Article 44 The judicial officers shall deal with all cases impartially and in accordance with the law.
sentences.chinese: 第四十四条审判人员应当依法秉公办案。

sentences.english: To practice calligraphy is the requirement of increasing the level of enforcing the law and solving the case.
sentences.chinese: 练字，是提高执法办案水平的需要。

sentences.english: Article 44 The adjudicating personnel shall handle the case impartially and according to law.
sentences.chinese: 第四十四条审判人员应当依法秉公办案。

sentences.english: For a long time he has worried me to write an experience of my own.
sentences.chinese: 很久以来他就一直在撺掇我自己写一篇办案记录。

sentences.english: Article 44 The judicial personnel shall handle the case impartially and in accordance with the law.
sentences.chinese: 第四十四条审判人员应当依法秉公办案。

sentences.english: According to personnel, the 45-year-old Chen was the Wuhan people.
sentences.chinese: 据办案人员介绍，现年45岁的陈某是武汉人。

sentences.english: Judges shall hanDle cases impartially and in accordance with the law.
sentences.chinese: 审判人员应当依法秉公办案。

sentences.english: Last year, the total number of times a firearm was discharged by all the AFOs in the service was just two.
sentences.chinese: 去年，所有授权持枪警察的办案开枪总数只有两次。

sentences.english: She disrupts the rhythm completely which how Ruffian &Hero handles a case.
sentences.chinese: 完全打乱痞子英雄办案的节奏。

sentences.english: A lawyer Builds his case on facts.
Marshal: There have to be rules, Marston. Even you must understand that.
sentences.chinese: 就算你也得明白，办案是要依照规定的。

definition: public prosecutor/public procurator (judicial officer whose job may involve both criminal investigation and public prosecution)
to commit sb for trial/to bring sb for interrogation
to solve a case/shabby old table
a misjudged legal case/a miscarriage (of justice)
to investigate (as detective)/to solve (crime)/to uncover (a plot)/to sniff out/to break in and analyze/detective work/to scout
to register (to an official organism)/to file a case (for investigation)
